text: Jean Charles Louis Dubois de Gennes (15 April 1814 – 15 May 1876) was a 19th- century French writer, journalist and chansonnier. A former military and member of the Société du Caveau, collaborator of the Almanach pour rire, he is remembered for his correspondence with Victor Hugo.Victor Hugo, : souvenirs, journaux, cahiers, 1972, (p. 155) He also published under the pseudonym Claudius Transiens.Emil Weller, Lexicon pseudonymorum, 1963, p. 116. == Works == *1851: Dors-tu Marie ?, melody by Henri Caspers *1862: Le Troupier tel qu'il est à cheval *1865: Les Envieux *1867: La Huronne, scènes de la vie canadienne, by Émile Chevalier (preface) *1869: Sous le casque, rimes à la dragonne, with Victor Hugo (letter) *1874: Chasse aux femmes et aux lions en Algérie == Bibliography == * Joseph-Marie Quérard, Les supercheries littéraires dévoilées, 1882, (p. 993) * Henri Frotier de La Messelière, Filiations bretonnes. 1650-1912, vol.6, 1976, (p. 159) == References == == External links == * Sudoc Texts on Sudoc Category:19th-century French journalists Category:French male journalists Category:French chansonniers Category:1814 births Category:People from Dumfries Category:1876 deaths Category:19th-century French male writers
title: Charles Dubois de Gennes
